definition: dripping water penetrates the stone (idiom); constant perseverance yields success/You can achieve your aim if you try hard without giving up./Persistent effort overcomes any difficulty.
a drop/to drip
surname Shui
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
to wear/to put on/to dress/to bore through/to pierce/to perforate/to penetrate/to pass through/to thread
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
surname Shi
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: The eonstant dropping of water wears away the stone. This is Its tenacity, stamina and persistence.
sentences.chinese: 滴水穿石，这就是它的韧性。

sentences.english: The eonstant dropping of water wears away the stone.
sentences.chinese: 滴水穿石，这就是它的韧性。

sentences.english: Water is a skillful carver. "Constant dripping wears away stone" is his masterpiece.
sentences.chinese: 水是技艺高超的雕刻家，滴水穿石是他的杰作。

definition: dripping water penetrates the stone (idiom); constant perseverance yields success/You can achieve your aim if you try hard without giving up./Persistent effort overcomes any difficulty.
dripping water penetrates the stone (idiom); constant perseverance yields success/You can achieve your aim if you try hard without giving up./Persistent effort overcomes any difficulty.
see 磨杵成針|磨杵成针[mo2 chu3 cheng2 zhen1]
to grind an iron bar down to a fine needle (idiom); fig. to persevere in a difficult task/to study diligently
lit. piling up dirt eventually creates a mountain (idiom)/fig. success is the cumulation of lots of small actions
effort will undoubtedly lead to success (idiom)
to pursue unremittingly (idiom); to persevere

If you work at it hard enough, you can grind an iron bar into a needle./cf idiom 磨杵成針|磨杵成针, to grind an iron bar down to a fine needle (idiom); fig. to persevere in a difficult task/to study diligently
pinyin: zhi3 yao4 gong1 fu5 shen1 , tie3 chu3 mo2 cheng2 zhen1
related.word: 只要功夫深，铁杵磨成针

definition: many hairs make a fur coat (idiom); many small contributions add up to sth big/many a mickle makes a muckle
to accumulate over a long period of time
sand grains accumulate to make a tower a tower (idiom); by gathering small amounts one gets a huge quantity/many a mickle makes a muckle
to keep on fighting in spite of all setbacks (idiom)/to be undaunted by repeated setbacks/to be indomitable
to persevere unremittingly (idiom); to keep going until the end
untiring/unremitting/indefatigable
lit. navigating a boat against the current (idiom)/fig. in a tough environment (one needs to work hard)
a dripstone (geology)/stalactites and stalagmites
